comment: 1st day of class, he went over why so many students fail his class for the entire class period. What a great start. Then on top of that he doesn't post much of anything on his D2L page. If he did, he said he would take it down after a few days.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Really nice grader on the labs with high A averages across most of the class. Other scores are from 6 quizzes and the final, all of which are given ample practice questions and guided notes. All in all not a stressful class but does require a bit more practice for certain chapters. Be prepared for Jenkins to go off on tangents though haha

Brent Jenkins genuinely is the worst professor I have taken at KSU. I took him for Engineering Electronics, he did not teach the material, made his tests different from the recommended study material, failed us all as a result and refused to accept responsibility. I can confidently say to NOT take this professor. (average on test #2 was a 20%...)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
The entire class comes down to 6 twenty minute timed quizzes. There's no opportunity for extra credit nor are you graded on anything else. This would be fair IF HE PROVIDED WORKED OUT EXAMPLES but he is worried that students will use this cheat "because I had a student once a long time ago..."

Extremely frustrating and archaic professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He's a nice guy, but he barely understands the subject. He's the kind of professor to teach programming on a whiteboard. It's time for him to step down or retire.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Terrible. He refused to upload almost any resources online, including practice problems, the syllabus, and even my grades (that is, when he even bothered to grade). For a majority of my semester with him, I only knew my scores on quizzes 1 and 3 (We got quiz 2 back on the last week of class). PLEASE avoid him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He will make you question your existence from boredom as you daydream during mandatory lecture that is graded at 4% of total grade. 6 Quizzes (tests) 56%, labs that have simple reports but are independently made and not graded until the final grade posting thus me going into the final and still not knowing if I am passing the class. Stay away.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: His lectures were very informative, the ungraded homework he assigns matches what the test is over, if not harder than the test. My only complaint is that he gives you around 30-45 min for the tests and then lectures afterwards.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I truly don't know how this professor is even allowed to teach at this school. He does not teach at all, nothing he goes over is related to the quizzes. He's lazy, boring, not caring, and just a complete waste of everyone's time. His attendance policy is so bad, if you miss one class you will loose 2 points on your overall grade. EE majors run!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Get ready for tirades on tech troubles and very few worked examples. He teaches from a pdf and draws (very slowly) diagrams on ms paint. A nice guy but a terrible teacher imo.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Worst professor ever. I can't believe he is still teaching at KSU. It's sad that he is the only professor teaching EE machines. Stay away if can, goodluck.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Brent is the result of the overall college ideology shifting from that of academia to a corporate business. Universities all over cut costs to save a dollar while increasing that of the high ups (president, provost, deans, etc). It isn't exactly his fault (well, kind of), but I put the blame on the system as a whole. Shame on this current state.

Professor Jenkins knows the material well, but this doesn't matter much because he goes off tangents when asked to explain something. Didn't grade most of our assignments before the final and would constantly complain about the situation he was in. Not a positive learning environment at all.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Your grade mainly depends on 6 quizzes that are 40 min each (56% of your final grade), and are 10 times harder than the hardest hw problem. Lab was a mess, sometimes we wouldnt even have lab bc he wouldn't prepare it on time, yet would blame everyone else. ZERO partial credit. Incompetent, didn't even give us all our grades. REPLACE HIM!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I suspect Professor Jenkins will not be employed with KSU in the near future. That, or he will get his stuff together. Terrible experience this summer. He puts on an act to care about students. Actions speak louder than words. He did very little relevant action. REPLACE HIM ALREADY

Do not take this professor. Partial credit is nonexistent when you have 40 minutes to take a quiz using lockdown and you are required to enter your work into a single-line text box. Beware that this professor is also unprepared to teach any of the labs online blaming others. This professor will go out of his way to make things harder.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Please I beg you to spare yourself and not take this professor for this class. You will receive your grades late. The lectures aren't representative on what's on the quizzes. There are a LOT of quizzes. If this is a last resort for you, just mentally prepare to be pushed to your limit. Avoid at all cost. I don't know how to be more clear on that.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: As long as you have previous assignments you should do fine, basically the same questions

Do not take this professor. He appears to be a good guy.. but........ There are so many things wrong with the way he teaches, grades, lectures, etc etc. Avoid at all costs if you can. Do-able, but you will not enjoy it.

Brent Jenkins is by far the worst Professor when it comes to getting feedback. Lectures, he usually spends half the class going off topic often times leaving you lost. 6 quizzes. During the pandemic he made the class actually more difficult. Quizzes were 25 minutes with 8+ questions (mind you each questions uses MULTIPLE steps) wouldnt recommend
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: First class I've ever failed. Lectures seem to make sense, but he leaves it up to you to apply them in homework (which is not explained), and it's the hard application that that shows up on the quizzes. We didn't get them back until the last 2-3 weeks, so I had no idea how badly I was doing. He seems distracted and is not approachable.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Jenkins is a really good lab instructor. He explains stuff that you forget from lecture and gives demonstrations on how to use the equipment. Overall, a solid choice. Only downside is he grades slowly, so don't expect grades until finals week
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Stay away from this professor! He grades you solely on 6 quizzes that have nothing at all to do with the material in the book. His class was so bad that literally half the class dropped and I'm sure 75% failed. He is disorganized, always late and can't explain the material for anything. I learned more about transformers in Circuits II.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many

comment: He is a very demanding teacher. Unlike the other professors that teach the same class, he chooses very in-depth problems resulting in MAYBE 2 being solved over the entirety of a lecture. This is a professor you want to take if you have the desire to learn the material fully rather than get an easy grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Solid professor who puts a lot into his class. Knows his stuff and knows how to explain it. Gives good note outlines for you to follow along with. Gives 6 quizzes and the final and grades with partial credit. Show up to class, take notes,  do homework,  and you should be fine. Can be long-winded, so prepare for him to go off on tangents sometimes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you have no background or interest in Electrical then beware of this class I had to take it twice and still barely passed. Awful teacher and he's the only instructor that's offered for this class. Administration really needs to address this class. Best of luck to you.

I had a difficult time in his class. His presentations are hand written in mspaint (hard to read and take notes). Subject matter is difficult and the way he teaches is confusing. He records his sessions, so you can review lectures from home before tests. Super helpful if the presentations are clear enough to understand.
Very respectful and knowledgeable. Thought his grading was a little harsh. Doesn't give any slack. Wants you to know the material very well.

Jenkins is fair teacher. His grading are 6 quizes which are basically tests. They are over the examples from class and the homework. To pass with a good grade practice those homework problems and examples from the class. He talks alot and goes off into different subjects which makes it hard for you to stay focus but stay focus

Great Professor.  Just do what he says and you will do fine in his class.  Work load is about what you would expect out of an engineering class.  He has the best intentions for all his students and genuinely wants them to succeed.  I wish I could take him as a math teacher, or any subject for that matter.  Favorite professor thus far.

He is a very thorough teacher. All the lessons are very though out. The subject matter is difficult but he is very helpful. Engineering as a whole will require you to work outside of class, he is always in his office during hours when you need help. I would take him for every class if possible.

My interest in the class died quickly after a couple of his lectures.  Forces a ton of information down your throat and gives you really hard quizzes every week over stuff you've never seen.  I really didn't like this class.  Although the antenna project was pretty cool.
The professor does not give back work to judge your progress. All graded work is handed back after final is over except for three of the eight quizzes.

He is a good teacher. The lecture is very detail and clear. The quizzes is very easy also. But the only problem is he returns all the quizzes usually takes about a month. And the lab report is not gonna return till you finished the final.
Grat Prof. really organezed notes. Do the homewok and you will do real good int eh class
willing to help a lot
Great teacher, take him if you want to learn and be ready for electronic 2.  He have problem with returning paper back.  Great teacher!

He is a great professor!  He really want u to understand the materials, if u dont do well in class he feel very bad as a bad teacher.  He want everyone to do great in his class.  His lecture is awesome!  But dam alot of note taking!  Study the note and the A's is ur!
Great professor. Explains material thouroughly, Assigns adequate amount of HW, but as long as you do the HW, the tests will be simple.
Do not take him, it takes him years to return assignments. He will never turn back labs.
Very nice and clear professor. Gives considerable amounts of Homework and does not overload. Do the home work problems and you will breeze through his class
